dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill c Kaia b Evans 130 (97b 15x4 1x6 145m) SR: 134.02

dismissalComment.html: Has Gill got enough on that? Nope and it is wicket No. 4 for Evans! Gill is being congratulated off the field by the Zimbabwe players as he walks off as that has been a top quality knock. He looks to tonk the length ball that is outside off over the fence but only gets more height than distance and finds long-off.

headshotImage.longCaption: Tony Munyonga, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Ishan Kishan run out (Munyonga) 50 (61b 6x4 0x6 82m) SR: 81.96

dismissalComment.html: Trapped in front? But Kishan seems to be run-out at the other end. Zimbabwe opt to take the lbw appeal against Gill upstairs, though. This was a length ball around off, Gill missed his flick and got it off the front pad to the off side. Replays show that Gill had an inside edge on that. Which means Kishan has to walk back. He had come down in search of a run but a direct hit at the bowler's end took him aback. End of the 140-run stand.

headshotImage.longCaption: KL Rahul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And Rahul's stay in the middle ends. Evans roars in delight. Back of a length ball outside off, comes in just a touch. Rahul looks to punch that but gets an inside edge onto his stumps. A rusty innings from the Indian captain ends.

headshotImage.caption: S Dhawan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: S Dhawan headshot

dismissalComment.html: leading edge taken at cover! Evans gets his second, he has snared both openers today. A soft dismissal because Evans angled the ball into the pads and Dhawan closed the face of the bat a bit too early and it led to a leading edge for the easiest of catches to Williams at cover

headshotImage.caption: Deepak Hooda, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Deepak Hooda, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Nip-backer cleans Hooda up! Hurled in on a length, he looks to drive it on the up and the ball sneaks in through bat and pad to hit the off bail. Two wickets in the over.

headshotImage.caption: Shubman Gill player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shubman Gill player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Has Gill got enough on that? Nope and it is wicket No. 4 for Evans! Gill is being congratulated off the field by the Zimbabwe players as he walks off as that has been a top quality knock. He looks to tonk the length ball that is outside off over the fence but only gets more height than distance and finds long-off.

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Maiden ODI five-wicket haul for Evans and how well has he bowled today! Length ball around off and middle but the key was that he had taken pace off it. Deceived Thakur completely who ended up being way early into the shot and skying it high via the toe end. Nyauchi at mid-off keeps his eye on that as he runs to his right and pouches it.

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Shubman Gill b Thakur 115 (95b 9x4 3x6 147m) SR: 121.05

dismissalComment.html: Shubman Gill take a bow! You cannot keep this young man out of the game today and Sikandar Raza has to walk back. Length ball, perhaps a knuckle ball, that he looks to heave over long-on. Fails to get the desired elevation. It was dying on fielder running in but Gill dives full length to pluck that inches off the ground. The smiles were tough to hide after that act. The Indians rightly go up to Raza after that fantastic knock. Is this a twist in the tale?

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams lbw b Patel 45 (46b 7x4 0x6 68m) SR: 97.82

dismissalComment.html: Axar has struck with his fourth ball and it's the big wicket of Williams! It's so plumb that Williams is n't reviewing this, he's walking back with his head falling back, eyes on the sky. Over the wicket, flat towards middle stump, and Williams is trapped right in front on the back foot

headshotImage.longCaption: Tony Munyonga, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: thick, outer edge of the bat on the off side and KL Rahul gets under it easily. Zimbabwe are crumbling now as India get another wicket. It was short of length around off but Munyonga decided to drive on the up and in the air ending in an easy catch for Rahul running to his left from mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Brad Evans, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Brad Evans, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Struck in front? Given! Evans goes for the DRS straight away. Length ball on off, he misses the heave to the on side and misses it completely. Did it hit him in line? Is it too high? Hawk-Eye should confirm it all. Three reds and ZImbabwe lose Evans and a review,

headshotImage.caption: Victor Nyauchi, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Victor Nyauchi, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Right in the blockhole and that's curtains to the game and the series. Spears it full and straight on middle, Nyauchi goes back but fails to dig it out. It's a clean sweep for India, yet again, in Zimbabwe, thanks to this 13-run win.

dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia lbw b Chahar 6 (9b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: A big inswinging yorker on off, India think it has hit Kaia's pad before his bat as he looks to dig it out. They don't get the decision for lbw in their favour and take it upstairs. Excellent review and it is three reds on Hawk-Eye! Kishan urged Rahul to go for the review and gets a huge cheer in the huddle. Chahar was pretty confident too. Good ball for starters as he set Kaia up with outswingers before getting this to sway back in.

dismissalComment.html: Shubman Gill take a bow! You cannot keep this young man out of the game today and Sikandar Raza has to walk back. Length ball, perhaps a knuckle ball, that he looks to heave over long-on. Fails to get the desired elevation. It was dying on fielder running in but Gill dives full length to pluck that inches off the ground. The smiles were tough to hide after that act. The Indians rightly go up to Raza after that fantastic knock. Is this a twist in the tale?

dismissalText.commentary: Victor Nyauchi b Avesh Khan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Right in the blockhole and that's curtains to the game and the series. Spears it full and straight on middle, Nyauchi goes back but fails to dig it out. It's a clean sweep for India, yet again, in Zimbabwe, thanks to this 13-run win.

commentPostTextItems.html: 5:50pm The victorious India pose for some picture behind the board that reads CHAMPIONS! Youngsters like Shahbaz Ahmed, Rahul Tripathi have the trophy in hand and are in the middle of it and the smiles say it all. It has been a clinical performance from the tourists and despite being tested today by the humdinger, they came out with flying colours.

Vishal's report is already up here if you need to recap it all. Keep an eye for the post-match/series pieces from Sidharth Monga on the series page as well. That's all from us for this series. Hope you enjoyed our coverage as much as we did in bringing it all across. For now, on behalf of Thilak Rama and Vishal, this is me, Sudarshanan, bidding you adieu! Take care, stay safe! Ciao!

Bala: "Gill with his consistent approach in two series has been the Man of the Series in both. A great talent and potential for the future. He should be nurtured to take the crucial No.4 slot in all formats when time demands him to enter the fray."

For his magnificent ton and a superb catch at the end, the player of the match is Shubman Gill: "I was just trying to minimise my dot-ball percentage. I just tried to time the ball and not hit it hard. [On targeting bowlers] Raza, Evans were bowling well and it was crucial to target the bowlers. The bat was pretty good and that's why I changed it after my fifty as I wanted to save it. Always special to get a hundred, I had made three nineties but wanted to get a century."

Player of thee series, Shubman Gill again for his 245 runs: "It's a great bunch of players and I have been playing with them for sometime now. This one is for my dad as he has been my primary coach. I got a bit of schooling day before yesterday when I was out on 33. So this is for him."

Regis Chakabva, Zimbabwe captain: "Firstly congratulations to India, I thought they played well. India held their nerves even though Sikandar and Evans gave us the chance. Huge positives today from the bowling. The boys fought really hard on the field. We talk about coming back from tough situations and Raza was brilliant. We definitely take lot of positives and look at those things down under."

KL Rahul, India captain: "We came here with a few ideas and wanted to use these games. A few of us haven't got a game for some time and wanted to use the time. We were very professional with how we played. I wouldn't say nervous but Raza and Evans took it deep. But it is good that we were challenged and the bowlers were tested. I have fielded for about 150 overs and the body feels good. Will use this confidence for the next series. [On Gill] He has batted well throughout the series and did well in West Indies and the IPL. Pleasing to the eye when he bats and good to see him use his form and score runs and good to see his composure and to show the temperament despite not having played a lot of internationals."
Mustafa Moudi : "2 Important lesson from this series - Just Chill, if you have Gill and No Raza No Maza (fun) !!"
JOYDEEPSINGHGIL: "With brad Evans wicket by Avesh win india this match that wicket was the turning point "

5:22pm Tell me you have fingernails left after what we've just witnessed and I'd believe you! Shubman Gill, Brad Evans, Sikandar Raza - we had one act of magnificence over the other lined up. And a fantastic thrilling game to top it all! What is this Raza made of? Zimbabwe were down and out when they lost half their side with not even halfway through. Burl then fell miscuing one to mid-on. But in Evans - who earlier picked up his maiden ODI five-for - Raza found an ally for 104 runs that helped Zimbabwe think the impossible. Raza kept at it despite Evans falling.

And eventually, it needed a stunning catch from Gill - who earlier scored a maiden ODI hundred - for India to see the back of Raza. A classic back-to-the-beginning kind of a match to use a writing parlance. The scoreline will say 3-0 India but the third win was far from being easy.
Two days, two nail-biters. Netherlands almost got over the line against Pakistan yesterday. Zimbabwe almost did that today. Superb match to cap off the series.

Shiv: "Reminds me of the great 1987 WC game, Zim VS NZ. The current coach Dave Houghton played one of the best innings ever in a WC, Ian Butchart like Evans supporter him, and like today, ended few runs short"
Jonathan Dsouza: "Makes one wonder - how much of India's first 2 victories were on account of the advantage of bowling first?"

Sharan: "and THIS is why you need ODI cricket. 7 down in a T20 and match is over because you need 1-2 good overs to close it out, but in an ODI it allows you time for comebacks and the team in front has to keep playing good cricket. In T20s, a 3-4 over period with the bat/ball and the game is done. Tests, ODIs and T20s thats the right order. There, I said it "

commentPreTextItems.html: Harish : "Extraordinary innings came to an end with extraordinary catch !!"

commentTextItems.html: Low full toss outside off, smashes it over cover. He wanted a second and was halfway down but had to be sent back. Nyauchi wasn't sharp in his running and it is understandable.

commentPreTextItems.html: Fifteen needed off six! Avesh to bowl. Can he defend it?
Afeef: "Each of Raza's 3 ODI tons he made this month have come while chasing"

commentTextItems.html: Full and outside off, Ngarava looks to go over the off side but misses.

commentPreTextItems.html: Manav: "Heartbreak !!! Heartbreak !!! Heartbreak !!! PS: I am from India."

commentTextItems.html: Another length ball outside off, he has a swish but misses. Thakur has done his bit.

commentTextItems.html: Luck also favouring Zimbabwe now. Full and outside off, Evans goes for an almighty swing and gets a thick inside edge past off stump.
Full and outside off, drilled down to long-off.
That's made as good a sound as any of the crisp shots today. Length ball outside off, Raza has the required width. Smashes it over extra covers and it hits the cushions on the full.
Raza gets across and down on his knees as he scoops it over short fine leg. Makes good contacts and subtracts four from the equation. Fantastic batting.

commentPreTextItems.html: You'd imagine both Avesh and Thakur will bowl the remaining three overs. I'd say it could be advantage Zimbabwe given Avesh's inexperience. He will bowl the first of his two now.

commentTextItems.html: Length ball outside off, he reaches out and slaps it to long-off. Would have been a wide had he left it alone.

commentPreTextItems.html: Vasan: "8/10 times, one would expect the batting team to chase down this total, in this day and age. Go Zim Go!!!"

commentTextItems.html: Full and outside off, Raza flays it over covers. Doesn't make great contact and just gets two.

dismissalText.commentary: Ishan Kishan run out (Munyonga) 50 (61b 6x4 0x6 82m) SR: 81.96

dismissalComment.html: Trapped in front? But Kishan seems to be run-out at the other end. Zimbabwe opt to take the lbw appeal against Gill upstairs, though. This was a length ball around off, Gill missed his flick and got it off the front pad to the off side. Replays show that Gill had an inside edge on that. Which means Kishan has to walk back. He had come down in search of a run but a direct hit at the bowler's end took him aback. End of the 140-run stand.

dismissalText.commentary: Ishan Kishan run out (Munyonga) 50 (61b 6x4 0x6 82m) SR: 81.96

dismissalComment.html: Trapped in front? But Kishan seems to be run-out at the other end. Zimbabwe opt to take the lbw appeal against Gill upstairs, though. This was a length ball around off, Gill missed his flick and got it off the front pad to the off side. Replays show that Gill had an inside edge on that. Which means Kishan has to walk back. He had come down in search of a run but a direct hit at the bowler's end took him aback. End of the 140-run stand.

dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia lbw b Chahar 6 (9b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: A big inswinging yorker on off, India think it has hit Kaia's pad before his bat as he looks to dig it out. They don't get the decision for lbw in their favour and take it upstairs. Excellent review and it is three reds on Hawk-Eye! Kishan urged Rahul to go for the review and gets a huge cheer in the huddle. Chahar was pretty confident too. Good ball for starters as he set Kaia up with outswingers before getting this to sway back in.

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Shubman Gill b Thakur 115 (95b 9x4 3x6 147m) SR: 121.05

dismissalComment.html: Shubman Gill take a bow! You cannot keep this young man out of the game today and Sikandar Raza has to walk back. Length ball, perhaps a knuckle ball, that he looks to heave over long-on. Fails to get the desired elevation. It was dying on fielder running in but Gill dives full length to pluck that inches off the ground. The smiles were tough to hide after that act. The Indians rightly go up to Raza after that fantastic knock. Is this a twist in the tale?

dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia lbw b Chahar 6 (9b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: A big inswinging yorker on off, India think it has hit Kaia's pad before his bat as he looks to dig it out. They don't get the decision for lbw in their favour and take it upstairs. Excellent review and it is three reds on Hawk-Eye! Kishan urged Rahul to go for the review and gets a huge cheer in the huddle. Chahar was pretty confident too. Good ball for starters as he set Kaia up with outswingers before getting this to sway back in.

dismissalText.commentary: Brad Evans lbw b Avesh Khan 28 (36b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: Struck in front? Given! Evans goes for the DRS straight away. Length ball on off, he misses the heave to the on side and misses it completely. Did it hit him in line? Is it too high? Hawk-Eye should confirm it all. Three reds and ZImbabwe lose Evans and a review,

headshotImage.longCaption: Shubman Gill player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Shubman Gill b Thakur 115 (95b 9x4 3x6 147m) SR: 121.05

dismissalComment.html: Shubman Gill take a bow! You cannot keep this young man out of the game today and Sikandar Raza has to walk back. Length ball, perhaps a knuckle ball, that he looks to heave over long-on. Fails to get the desired elevation. It was dying on fielder running in but Gill dives full length to pluck that inches off the ground. The smiles were tough to hide after that act. The Indians rightly go up to Raza after that fantastic knock. Is this a twist in the tale?

dismissalText.commentary: Victor Nyauchi b Avesh Khan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Right in the blockhole and that's curtains to the game and the series. Spears it full and straight on middle, Nyauchi goes back but fails to dig it out. It's a clean sweep for India, yet again, in Zimbabwe, thanks to this 13-run win.
